sub_title: Cluster Leader Specification Management FrieslandCampina Ingredients at FrieslandCampina
summary:
I'm an experienced R&D professional with a demonstrated history of working in the food & beverages industry (both FMCG and B2B). 
For both program and project management I'm professionally skilled in product development, food safety and quality as well as in training development and training employees.
I’m a structured, well organised person, who is strong at building bridges, asking the right (critical) questions, listening and putting theories into practice. I’m said to bring conscience to a company, as well as a positive, friendly atmosphere.

profile_positions.description:
Leading the specification management team, and accountable for the knowledge, quality and compliance of specification and recipe information end to end, meaning from raw material to finished product specification used in the different segments of FCI.
•	Responsible for the set up and people management of the specification team (6 to 9 dedicated specialists) as well as setting up and implementing robust specification management processes
•	Actively supporting the implementation of the new global specification management IT tool in the different segments within FrieslandCampina Ingredients (FCI)
•	Setting-up and executing the strategy for specification management within FCI leading to first time right quality for product or raw material change across the supply chain as well as identification of opportunities and taking action for improvements in way of working, increasing efficiency and reducing complexity
•	Point of contact and sparring partner for internal and external stakeholders considering specification and recipe management related topics
profile_positions.title: Cluster Leader Specification Management FrieslandCampina Ingredients

profile_positions.description:
Led the phased implementation of the new specification management IT tool for part of the Early Life Nutrition portfolio in close collaboration with IT, as well as built a robust and professional ELN specification management team to fully run the specification management business when implementation was completed.
•	Coordinated and supported the data migration of largest part of ELN specs and recipes into the new IT tool in collaboration with IT and external consultants
•	Implemented the new way of working into the business (R&D, sales and supply chain) by stakeholder management as well as by organising training for end users 
•	Coordinated the daily business activities (specification and recipe creation and changes) of the newly built ELN specification team after implementation of the IT tool, as well as ensured a smooth cooperation with the surrounding disciplines (Supply chain, RA, QA) and other stakeholders
profile_positions.title: Global specification manager Early Life Nutrition

profile_positions.description:
Leading the team which is responsible for the upgrade of current ingredient specifications to Global PepsiCo ingredient standards for the Western Europe snacks category. Ensured a fit-for-purpose launch of the new (IT) tools to be used for that by representing the Europe (East and West) snacks category in the global project team as well as prepare the data migration from current specification documents to the new IT tools.
•	Prepared the data migration of 3000+ raw material specifications, leading to the identification of 50+ Europe specific parameters to be implemented. 
•	Ran a pilot with 5 global seasoning suppliers to test drive the new IT tools, taking out 50+ defects. 
•	Led the engagement of 15+ suppliers and ensured a smooth cooperation and completion of the new specification format.
profile_positions.title: R&D Project Manager transformation

profile_positions.description:
In August 2014 became a trainer and super user on new to be implemented global product development procedures (Technical Stage Gate) and standards, rolled out training in West Europe locations and functioned as an expert on these new standards for the Western Europe R&D community. 
Before that, managed the development cycle from idea to launch for savoury snack products. Played a key role in the cross-functional projects teams representing R&D. Prepared raw material, process and finished product specifications, and documentation required to support new product implementation. Generated artwork specifications including ingredient list, nutritional information, claims and GDA. (Supervised 1 direct report for 2 years in snacks development work).
•	Trained 100+ R&D people internationally on various levels at various international locations on new procedures and their yearly updates.
•      Successfully developed 10+ products which were launched in multiple countries in Western Europe.
profile_positions.title: R&D Trainer and Superuser Technical Stage Gate/ R&D Project Manager Snacks Western Europe
